title: Legally blind paedophile claiming to be a witch is freed after using two teenage girls as sex slaves
text:
News Blind, paedophile 'witch' who used two teenage girls as sex slaves is freed from prison Robin Angas Fletcher was a drug abuse and sexual guidance counsellor at the time of his crimes, which he claimed were "Pagan rituals", against two 15-year-olds Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Controversy as 'evil sex witch' is let back into community Share this video Get daily   Thank you for subscribing!   
A convicted paedophile who claims to be a Wiccan witch has been freed to live in a community without supervision. 
Robin Angas Fletcher, 60 and who is legally blind, was jailed in 1998 after he used two 15-year-old girls as sex slaves. 
He was a drug abuse and sexual guidance counsellor at the time of the crimes, which he claimed were "Pagan rituals". 
Victims' rights groups reacted with disgust in response to the decision to free Fletcher, who no longer has to wear a monitoring bracelet on his ankle. Robin Angas Fletcher leaves the Court of Appeal 
He was allowed to go free after Australia's Court of Appeal upheld a Supreme Court decision finding that he was no longer an unacceptable risk, according to the law, due to his age, vision impairment and mobility issues, 9 News reported. Read More Hard hitting advert in bid to combat sexual abuse on public transport shows no one should leave it unreported 
The Supreme Court had ruled that a supervision order should be revoked after being twice extended. An appeal was filed by the Department of Justice. 
He had been under supervision in a facility for serious sex offenders and wearing an ankle monitoring bracelet since he was released from prison in 2006. 
Now he will live without supervision in an unidentified community in the state of Victoria. 
Fletcher used mind-altering techniques and hypnotism to prostitute the teenage girls, claiming they were fulfilling their destiny as "high priestesses of the dark covenant". 
He was jailed after admitting one count of prostituting a child, one count of sexual penetration of a child and three of committing an indecent act with a child. Read More 
One of his victims later took her own life. 
Victims of Crime advocate Noel McNamara said Fletcher's release was “disgusting”. 
He added that his surviving victim still lives in fear of him. 
Mr McNamara told 9 News: “She'll be horrified, she's terrified of him while he was inside let alone. She really believes he'll go after her. 
“It’s disgusting I think because he’s a real perpetrator, he’s a very evil man.” Read More Violent paedophile went on X Factor while police hunted him for raping 10-year-old girl 
In their ruling Court of Appeal President Justice Chris Maxwell, Justice Robert Redlich and Justice David Beach acknowledged the crimes but agreed with the Supreme Court decision. 
The ruling stated: "The criminal justice system imposes punishment on sex offenders and, in the ordinary course, an offender who has served his/her sentence is entitled to be released." Like us on Facebook
